graphicslib3D
Class GLSLUtils

java.lang.Object
  graphicslib3D.GLSLUtils

public class GLSLUtils
extends java.lang.Object

This class defines a set of static utility methods useful when manipulating GLSL shader programs in a JOGL OpenGL environment, including routines to read shader source from a file, fetch and print shader and shader program information logs, and check for OpenGL errors.

Constructor Summary

static boolean printOpenGLError(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable)
          Prints a message describing any OpenGL errors which have occurred.
static void printProgramInfoLog(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable, int program)
          Fetches and prints the Program Information Log for the GLSL shader program specified by parameter "program", which must be a legal GLSL program object ID.
static void printShaderInfoLog(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable, int shader)
          Fetches and prints the Shader Information Log for the GLSL shader specified by parameter "shader", which must be a legal shader object ID.
static void printShaderSource(java.lang.String[] program)
          Prints the set of lines contained in the specified array, which is assumed to be a GLSL shader program with each line terminated with an appropriate line terminator.

Constructor Detail

GLSLUtils

public GLSLUtils()
Method Detail

readShaderSource

public static java.lang.String[] readShaderSource(java.lang.String filename)
Reads the specified text file and returns an array of strings where each string contains one line of text from the file. One line of text from the file is defined as all characters up to, but not including, a line terminator (CR, LF, or CRLF). Each returned string is terminated with a LF ("newline") character. An IOException is generated if no file named "filename" is found.

printShaderSource

public static void printShaderSource(java.lang.String[] program)
Prints the set of lines contained in the specified array, which is assumed to be a GLSL shader program with each line terminated with an appropriate line terminator.

printOpenGLError

public static boolean printOpenGLError(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable)
Prints a message describing any OpenGL errors which have occurred. Returns true if errors were found; false otherwise. Input parameter "drawable" must be a valid GLDrawable, from which the GL context to be checked for errors is extracted.

printShaderInfoLog

public static void printShaderInfoLog(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable,
                                      int shader)
Fetches and prints the Shader Information Log for the GLSL shader specified by parameter "shader", which must be a legal shader object ID. Parameter "drawable" must be a valid GLDrawable giving the current GL context.

printProgramInfoLog

public static void printProgramInfoLog(javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable,
                                       int program)
Fetches and prints the Program Information Log for the GLSL shader program specified by parameter "program", which must be a legal GLSL program object ID. Parameter "drawable" must be a valid GLDrawable giving the current GL context.
